questions.question: It is a small data sent by a server to a user’s web browser to tell if two request is sent form the same browser.

questions.question: It is a java servlet used to handle HTTP requests and generate responses for a website.
It is an interface that provides request information for HTTP servlets.
It is an interface that provides Http-specific functionality for sending responses.
It is an interface that contains all the set of methods that a servlet uses to communicate with its servlet container.
It gets configuration information from the web.xml file.
Set, get, or remove attributes from the web.xml file, and provide inter-application communication.
It is a method of ServletContext Interface that returns the names of the context’s initialization parameters.
It is a method of ServletContext Interface that removes the attribute with the given name from the servlet context.
choices: <input type='radio' name='q11' id='k1' value = 'q11'><label for='k1'>removeAttribute(String name)</label></br>
<input type='radio' name='q11' id='k2' value = 'q11'><label for='k2'>deleteAttribute(String name)</label></br>

questions.question: It is responsible for creating the scripts on a web server that handles the responses made for a client’s request to the website.
choices: <input type='radio' name='q12' id='l1' value = 'q12'><label for='l1'>Server-side Scripting </label></br>
<input type='radio' name='q12' id='l2' value = 'q12'><label for='l2'>Client-side Scripting</label></br>

questions.question: Java objects that are intended to play the role of server components in client-server communications.
choices: <input type='radio' name='q13' id='n1' value = 'q13'><label for='n1'>Java Servlets</label></br>
<input type='radio' name='q13' id='n2' value = 'q13'><label for='n2'>Java server</label></br>

questions.question: This refers to the process that includes the creation of a servlet up to its destruction.

questions.question: It is similar to JavaScript that allows a web developer, to embed some programs into the HTML code of a web page.
It is used for web development but is also used as a general-purpose programming language.
It is an asynchronous event driven server-side Javascript runtime environment.
A component of Node.js that are imported for use in source code for easier and faster coding.

questions.question: What is the right way of implementing a module?
choices: <input type='radio' name='q20' id='u1' value = 'q20'><label for='u1'>const module = require(‘<Module Name>’)</label></br>
<input type='radio' name='q20' id='u2' value = 'q20'><label for='u2'>const module = include('<Module Name>')</label></br>
